snippet: SCIAMSI--Marie-Jeanine. Jeanine Sciamsi (89) returned to her Heavenly Father Thursday afternoon. Jeanine was born in Paris, France and immigrated to the US with her parents, Charlotte and Assaad, and sisters in August of 1953, becoming a US citizen in the spring of 1966. Ms. Sciamsi was the directress of Galerie Felix Vercel for over 30 years before retiring to her home on the east side of Manhattan. In her later years, she lived at Merry Heart Assisted Living in New Jersey near her loving niece. Ms Sciamsi was the eldest of her sisters, Lydia and Bernadette, both of whom predeceased her. Jeanine leaves behind her brother-in-law Charlie Khouri; nieces Christine (Joseph Kissick), Genevieve (Martin Schmidt) and Brigitte (Stephen Kahn); great-nieces and nephews: Joseph, Marielle, Charles, Danielle, Martin, Martine, Andrew, Robert, and James. Jeanine was a faithful member of the St. Patrick's Cathedral for over 25 years. Mass will be held tomorrow at St. Raymond's Church in the Bronx, NY at 10:45 followed by a burial in St. Raymond's Cemetery. In lieu of flowers, donations will be made to the Ephremite Sisters of the Syriac Catholic Church. For further details please email: ninette0530@gmail.com. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SCIAMSI, MARIE, JEANINE
